answers.answer: Hi, Normal Blood pressure range is Systolic BP: 90-139 mmHg, Diastolic BP: 60-89 mmHg and Pulse rate: 60- 99 beats/min. So, your blood pressure values are within the normal range, but your heart rate is on the higher side.Your doctor may be referring you to know the long term effects of raised pressures on the heart. As you are a hypertensive you fall in the high risk group. It could be just a preventive consult. What about diabetes and lipids? Are they normal. Good luck with your consult. Regards.

question: I have been taking blood pressure medicne for several years and my doctor has made a multiple number of changes of types/dosages and combination of medinces I have been taking.  I am 42 years old.  My BP is not perfect with the medication but it is not in the danger zones based on the guidelines.  My average daily readings over the past three months is 126/85 with a heart rate of 108.  My doctor wants be to see a specialist now to look at my blood pressure.  Is this necessary with this type of number?  Is he being overly cautious?
title: PCP wants be to see a specialist
